HSG PRIVACY POLICY

Updated: 1/4/18

Founded in 1978, Health Systems Group is a national provider of Fitness, Wellness, and Recreation Consulting and Management Services (Health Systems Group, its affiliates and business partners are hereinafter collectively referred to as “HSG”, “we”, “ our” or “us” in this Privacy Policy). We have long practiced confidentiality in the handling of all Personal Information (defined below) collected from our clients. HSG only uses the information we are given to provide the services for which we have been retained. We have designed this Privacy Policy based on the Canada’sPersonal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (“ PIPEDA”) and applicable provincial legislation. It reflects HSG’s commitment to the privacy and confidentiality of our clients’ Personal Information and sets out how HSG collects, holds, uses, transfers and discloses and safeguards the Personal Information that you provide to us.

Please read this Privacy Policy carefully. If you do not agree with this Privacy Policy, please do not submit or otherwise disclose Personal Information to us.

Accountability

The purpose of this Privacy Policy is to inform you of our commitment to the protection of your Personal Information and the rules we intend to follow when we collect, hold, use, transfer or disclose your Personal Information. Our privacy commitment includes ensuring the accuracy, confidentiality, and security of your Personal Information and allowing you to request access to, and correction or deletion of your Personal Information as required by applicable law. We make every effort to handle your Personal Information in a manner that is consistent with applicable privacy laws.

The Personal Information HSG collects, or is provided, is used and disclosed for the purposes of conducting the services which we provide.

HSG has assigned a Privacy Officer to provide client service on matters of privacy relating to HSG’s use, disclosure, security and retention of Personal Information including personal health information. HSG’s Privacy Officer is also responsible for maintaining this policy and updating staff on changes to both privacy legislation and business practices.

How does this Privacy Policy define “Personal Information” and “Analytics Data”?

“ Personal Information " means information that can be used to identify, locate or contact an individual. HSG may collect and maintain the following Personal Information in its files:

  • Contact Information that allows HSG to identify and to communicate with individuals such as the name of an emergency contact and the physical address, email address and phone number of the individual.
  • Demographics Information that allows HSG to monitor an individual’s progress through a wellness program, such as your age, sex, height and weight, workout history, and other information you may provide us related to nutrition, movement, mindset and recovery in order to allow us to provide the services you request.
  • Transaction Information about how an individual interacts with HSG including memberships, purchases, inquiries, and customer accounts.
  • Financial Information as needed to facilitate purchases, such as credit card information.
  • Applicant Information as needed from those who apply for jobs and internships with HSG.
  • Exercise Information about an individual’s exercise activity and physical performance.

Personal Information for the purpose of this policy does not include information disclosed in the form of aggregate data. In this context, aggregate data refers to data that does not reveal and cannot be manipulated to reveal, person-specific information.

“Analytics Data” means data generated by, collected by, transmitted from, or stored in equipment based on its use. Analytics data includes information gathered from an individual’s use of workout equipment, information transmitted by computer or mobile device when interacting with our online properties, such as, for example, server logging information. Analytics data also includes information transmitted from an individual’s computer or mobile device when interacting with cookies, web beacons, and other tracking objects.

Purpose for collecting and using Personal Information and Analytics Data

HSG collects and may use Personal Information and Analytics Data in the course of providing services to our clients to the extent that it is reasonably necessary to fulfill the following purposes:

  • Fitness, Wellness, and Recreation Consulting and Management Services;
  • Customer Service : to contact you about important service announcements and updates regarding our websites, products or services, or to fulfill orders for products or services, and for other services related to your order;
  • Marketing : to provide you with communications and offers for products and services from HSG or our suppliers and partners, including offers based on your interests, personal characteristics and location;
  • Surveys & Promotional Events : to administer surveys, polls, sweepstakes, contests, loyalty programs and other promotional events;
  • Eligibility : to determine if you are eligible for certain products, services or offers;
  • Communications : to provide you with information that may be of interest, such as company magazines, catalogs, announcements and reminders;
  • Managing our Business Needs : such as payment processing and financial account management, product development, product safety, contract management, website administration, web-forum management, order or contract fulfillment, analytics, fraud prevention, corporate governance, reporting and legal compliance;
  • Responding to your inquiries : if you send us questions or requests, we may use your information (including your Personal Information) to respond to your questions or requests;
  • Compliance with Applicable Laws : to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations, to comply with a subpoena or court order or to comply with the rules of court regarding the production of records;
  • Breach of an Agreement : to investigate an anticipated breach of an agreement; and
  • Security : to ensure the security and processing of your Personal Information.

HSG limits its collection of Personal Information to that which is reasonably required to accurately complete the services for which we have been retained. We are committed to respecting the privacy of an individual’s Personal Information and will not collect Personal Information which is not reasonably required.

Consent

We require that consent to use Personal Information be obtained at the time of its collection. If HSG collects the Personal Information directly from an individual, HSG will obtain express consent for the collection, use, transfer and disclosure of your Personal Information as outlined in this Privacy Policy. If you do not consent, please do not provide or otherwise disclose your Personal Information. Subject to legal and contractual requirements and reasonable notice, you may refuse to consent to our collection, use, transfer and disclosure of your Personal Information or you may withdraw your consent by contacting our Privacy Officer as detailed below. We will explain the consequences of the withdrawal of your consent. Your decision to withhold or withdraw your consent to certain uses of Personal Information may restrict our ability to provide certain services to you.

However, HSG may be contracted by employers to provide third party consulting analysis of employer sponsored employee services, online programs or digital equipment. In these cases, Personal Information may be collected by another party before it is provided to HSG. Where possible in these circumstances, HSG will take reasonable measures to require that consent for their use of the Personal Information has been obtained.

If HSG uses Personal Information and Analytics Data it has collected, or has been provided, for any reasons other than those disclosed to an individual at the time consent was given, then HSG will seek to obtain consent for the new use of the information.

Disclosure and Retention of Personal Information

HSG retains Personal Information it collects only as long as it is necessary to completely fulfill our services. HSG maintains a records retention policy. The retention policy has been developed to meet HSG’s record retention requirements consistent with good business practices and known industry standards.

In the event that HSG decides to purchase, sell, reorganize or transfer the assets of a business, including any Personal Information held by that business, HSG’s client information may be subject to review for such purpose by another party. Should HSG or such other party wish to use any Personal Information for purposes not described herein, then consent for such use of the information will first be obtained.

Note: As is the case with all companies, HSG may be lawfully bound to disclose Personal Information for purposes other than those described at the time consent was obtained. These purposes have been described in applicable privacy legislation as those designed to protect personal and/or public interest.

Accuracy of and Access to Personal Information

HSG recognizes that Personal Information can change. We encourage our clients to keep their Personal Information current so that we may provide the best services possible.

If we are working with a company to manage a company-sponsored service or program, employees will be required to inform their employer of any changes to their Personal Information.

Where we have a direct client relationship, Personal Information can be changed upon inquiry by email, phone or fax and in certain circumstances, on a website provided and/or maintained by HSG. You have a right to access, correct or delete your Personal Information in HSG’s custody or control, subject to limited exceptions. A request to access Personal Information must be made in writing to the Privacy Officer and sufficient detail to identify the Personal Information and the correction or deletion of the information being sought should be provided.

In some circumstances, we may not be able to provide access to your Personal Information, for example if it contains the Personal Information of other persons, if it constitutes confidential commercial information, or if it is protected by solicitor-client privilege. If we deny your request for access to, or refuse a request to correct, your Personal Information, we will advise you of the reasons for this refusal.

If your Personal Information is demonstrated to be inaccurate or incomplete, within a reasonable time of being notified, HSG will update records to reflect changes in Personal Information.

The HSG Privacy Officer regularly reviews our practices and procedures to ensure compliance with this Privacy Policy and will note your correction or deletion request in the file, regardless of whether a change was made.

Safeguarding Personal Information

HSG is committed to ensuring the security of customer Personal Information in order to protect it from unauthorized access, collection, use and/or disclosure. HSG has inventoried the various ways in which we store information, and has put reasonable physical, organizational, and technological security measures in place for Personal Information, whether in paper, mechanical, electronic or other form, to ensure the security of this information within our premises, at any offsite storage locations and in our system databases.

The Privacy Policy terms have been explained to each authorized employee or agent. Each authorized employee or agent must acknowledge their understanding of this Privacy Policy and our privacy procedures. Moreover, HSG provides ongoing training to staff on privacy legislation and continues to update all staff on privacy related issues and legislation.

As part of the hiring process, each of our employees must sign a confidentiality agreement which outlines HSG’s expectation of its staff to act responsibly in the handling of client Personal Information. Through this agreement, employees are aware that a breach of confidentiality could result in termination of their employment.

We regularly review and update our security policies and controls to ensure ongoing Personal Information security as technology changes.

Transfer of Information to Other Countries

Personal Information may be accessed by or transferred to the United States, Europe or to our data processors elsewhere in the world for the purposes described in this Privacy Policy or for storage purposes. When we access or transfer Personal Information, we do so in compliance with applicable law. Additionally, we protect the privacy and security of Personal Information regardless of where it is processed or stored.

Only authorized HSG employees and our agents may access and use the Personal Information for the identified purposes.

Links to Other Sites

Health Systems Group is not responsible for the content or the privacy policies of websites to which it may link and our privacy policy does not apply to websites to which we may link.

HSG’s Commitment to Children’s Privacy

Protecting children’s privacy is important to us. It is our policy to respect children’s online privacy and all applicable laws. Health Systems Group recommends that children ask a parent for permission before sending Personal Information to HSG or to anyone else online.

Use of IP Addresses

An IP address is a number that is automatically assigned to your computer whenever you are surfing the internet. Web servers automatically identify your computer by its IP address. We may collect IP addresses for the purposes of system administration, aggregate data collection, and to audit the use of our website. When clients request pages from our website, our servers log the requesting clients’ IP addresses. We normally will not link IP addresses to anything personally identifiable, which means that clients’ sessions will be logged, but client identity remains anonymous to us. We can and will use IP addresses to identify a client when we feel it is necessary to enforce compliance with our rules or terms of service or to protect our service, website, or any person, or where it is otherwise authorized or required by law.

Response to Email Inquiries

When visitors or clients send email inquiries to Health Systems Group, the return email address is used to answer the email inquiry we receive. We do not share the return email address with any third party.

Contacting you by email

With your consent, we may send you commercial electronic messages (CEMs) to the email address you provided, including newsletters, information about our products and services, and other information and news that we believe may be of interest to you. If you no longer desire to receive these communications, you have the option to withdraw your consent to receive future communications at any time.

Changes to this Privacy Policy

HSG reserves the right to amend this Privacy Policy without prior notice to reflect technological advancements, legal and regulatory changes and good business practices. We will place a notice on our homepage when we make material changes to this Privacy Policy. Additionally, if the changes will materially affect the way we use or disclose previously collected Personal Information, we may also notify you about the change by sending a notice to you.

Questions about this Privacy Policy

HSG’s Privacy Officer is mandated to ensure that our Privacy Policy and internal Security and Record Retention Policies are maintained.

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or the practices described herein, please contact us.
